intro: Canthium barteri, commonly known as Barter's spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in open woodland or grassland habitats. Canthium barteri is often found in areas with well-drained soils and receives full sun exposure.
